metadata.title: CVE-2024-26735 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ipv6:sr: fix possible use-after-free and null-ptr-deref The pernet operationsstructure for the subsystem must be registered before registering thegeneric netlink family.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1177-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1177.192~14.04.1').
